  • City: LOS ANGELES

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: On October 23rd a packge was discovered that needed some extra tape. When the employee went to tape it up they discovered 4 aerosol cans inside and there were no markings or labels on the outside of the package that indicated and DG was inside the package. The package is being held pending an investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024101435
item.description:
Report X-2024101435

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: IAPX 1148 was reported releasing while located in the West Colton rail yard on track 204. The cause of the release was a missing, small, vapor phase valve inside of valve control box. The valve body was found on the floor of the control box. The valve body was reinstalled and secured stopping the release.

item.title: Report E-2024100679
item.description:
Report E-2024100679

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0616 XPO contacted the call center to report a spill in Blythe CA. XPO advised that due to a container failure 1 gallon of Cling No. 153 was released into the trailer floor from a 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of Cling No. 153 released due to the drum lid being defective. The contractors neutralized floor & trailer with Sodium Bicarbonate and overpacked drum to (1) 95-gallon metal drum, neutralized pallet to (1) 55-gallon metal drum, impacted and neutralized PPE and absorbents to (1) 30- gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIS REPORT DOES NOT INVOLVE A SPILL, DAMAGE TO OUTER CARTON ONLY. UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET ON TOP FROM ANOTHER DAMAGED PACKAGE. LQ MARKING OBSCURED BY SHIPPING LABEL. ALL GOODS INTACT. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024101607
item.description:
Report X-2024101607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-30T09:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: Bloomington
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An Engineering crew was working on a track next to track 22 (containing several Marathon Petroleum tank cars) in the West Colton rail yard, when they noticed a smell of propane. It was reported and I was dispatched. The entire cut of tank cars was inspected and CBTX 787961 was found to be leaking from the sample line with a hydrate forming around the plug, the hydrate was rinse off the valve was in the closed position, I attempted to tighten the valve, but it was closed, product is leaking past the valve. As the plug was being removed the release increased and did not slow down. The plug feeling like it may be cross threaded. With no way to address the release a midland kit was applied to the tank car. Tank car is scheduled to be transferred.

item.description:
Report X-2024101302

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF CARTAGE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Nico Maida OS, contacted safety and stated the trailer-660720 came in on the inbound, leaking from the nose of the trailer. The SC 158/SAN has not opened the trailer and it's spilling out onto the ground. The freight arrived spilling out onto ground. Safety informed SC to place down absorbant and so mething to keep the spill from entering waterways or drains. CURA advised that the product was damaged due to a load shift during transit and the commodity being crushed.

item.title: Report X-2024101378
item.description:
Report X-2024101378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered two metal paint cans inside and the lid had opened on one of them causing the release. There were no DG makings or paperwork indicating that the shipment contained UN1263. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and re being held at the location for the FAA.

item.title: Report E-2024100635
item.description:
Report E-2024100635

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 650000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO reported an unknown spill in a trailer. It was believed to be a UN1760. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed spill was at the back of the trailer and approximately .5 gallons spilled from a 5-gallon poly pail, 2 others were damaged from the load shifting but were leaking. Contractors used absorbents to clean up the spill and containerized loose-packed product into a 55-gallon metal drum, impacted absorbents were contained to a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100590
item.description:
Report E-2024100590

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 55-gallon DF containing hazardous product, Starlite Built Liquid Alkali. A contractor dispatched and observed a 55-gallon release (total loss) of product due to a forklift puncture that impacted the trailer floor in a 40x8.5 area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 40x10 area. The contractor neutralized the release with citric acid and contained the release with oil dry and booms. Four drums of waste were generated from the response that contained the RCRA-empty drum, the neutralized impacted oil dry, shrink-wrap, and booms. XPO will manage all waste generated from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

Inside are 3 plastic bottles of 121 fl oz of Clorxpro Germicidal Bleach Concentrated.The glue used to secure the bottom flap was open. One of the bottles was dent on the body. 7 this made that safety tape seal of the bottle came off with. spilling its content.

Report X-2024101496

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-20
  • City: ONTARIO

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE BROKE OPEN REVEALING MULTIPLE SODASTREAM CANISTERS. THERE ARE TWENTY-SIX SODASTREAM CANISTERS CLASSIFIED AS UN1013, CARBON DIOXIDE WITH THE 2.2 NON-FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND ON EACH CANISTER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. NO INDICATION OF SODASTREAM SPECIAL PERMIT USAGE ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
